title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the monetary base will increase by $20,000 and/or does not explain that the central bank bond purchase increases reserves by $20,000 and the monetary base includes is the sum of reserves and currency in circulation.

The response states that the monetary base will increase by $20,000 and explains that the central bank bond purchase increases reserves by $20,000 and the monetary base includes is the sum of reserves and currency in circulation.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the price level will increase in the short run and/or does not explain that the increase in the money supply will decrease the nominal interest rate, which will increase interest-sensitive spending and increase aggregate demand.

The response states that the price level will increase in the short run and explains that the increase in the money supply will decrease the nominal interest rate, which will increase interest-sensitive spending and increase aggregate demand.
